comments.text: Police check-point (alcabala). Ask the guards to find a ride for you. Toward Puerto Ordaz and Ciudad Bolivar easy, I did not try to go further from there but a lot of truck crossing the Orinoco here.

Ask someone for the direction of the alcabala (police control). There are 2 alcabala with a gas station (bombera) in between. Ask some help to the Guardia National. I catched a ride for Maturin in 15min thanks to the guard.
I stood a little further than the border with my thumb up. I just finished my cigarette and a pick-up stopped and too me to Santa-Elena.
A good peage with a lot of truck early in the morning.

A good gas station (Bombera) of the national company. Some truck. Asking for a ride to the next alcabala was easier to catch a ride. Got a ride to Ciudad Guyana in 2 hours (the station was closed due to a lock of oil).
good spot to leave Caracas in every direction - Maracay, Valencia, Merida... Take the metro number 3 do Mercado and walk five minutes.
great spot to get a ride to caracas. there's a better gas station 1km further - hitch or walk there.
I have gone to Choroni direction for 2 hours (tt was very beauteaful view) then I have found the car.

Get in direction of Choroni.
It is the end stop of buses (but I don't know which).
OK. It is way to Maracay.

Get in directoin of Maracay.
Very close to Coche subway station.
